prompt_markdown: What is a **file descriptor**? Explain what the numbers 0, 1, and 2 represent by convention, and why this abstraction is powerful.

criteria.name: definition
criteria.description: Correctly defines file descriptor as integer handle to an open resource

criteria.name: abstraction
criteria.description: Explains the power of the abstraction (uniform interface, redirection)

expected_key_points: file descriptor is an integer referencing an open file/resource
0 = standard input, 1 = standard output, 2 = standard error
files, sockets, pipes all use the same interface
common_mistakes: confusing file descriptor with file pointer (FILE*)
not knowing the standard FD numbers
thinking FDs only work with files on disk
